name: productivity_pulse
description: Monthly productivity highlights for facility partners. Compares service-line performance across facilities using apples-to-apples metrics (ICUs to ICUs, floors to floors, etc.). Focuses on staffing efficiency and key trends.

task_and_purpose.task: Summarize monthly service-line productivity metrics and highlight staffing efficiency trends across facility locations
task_and_purpose.purpose: Enable facility partners to understand resource utilization, identify over/understaffed areas, and inform collaborative staffing decisions

inputs.label: Service Line Breakdown Data (JSON)
inputs.description: Paste the full service-line-breakdown JSON with all assignment data

inputs.label: Reporting Month (e.g., 'November 2025')
inputs.description: The month and year for this report

inputs.label: Which service lines should be highlighted? (comma-separated: ICU, Floor, Clinic, etc.)
inputs.description: Service line types to emphasize in this pulse email

inputs.label: What are the key business trends you want mentioned? (e.g., seasonal staffing shifts, new assignments)
inputs.description: Optional business context to weave into the narrative

inputs.label: Which metrics should drive the narrative? (e.g., 'avg_visits_per_shift', 'wrvu_per_shift')
inputs.description: Key metrics to compare and highlight across service lines

inputs.label: Which charts are you including? Describe them (e.g., 'Chart 1: Service Line Efficiency - wRVU per Shift by Facility')
inputs.description: Descriptions of charts/visualizations you are including with this email

sections.title: Email Subject Line
sections.description: Create a clear, data-focused subject that signals this is a routine update

sections.title: Opening Paragraph
sections.description: Professional greeting + context-setting for reporting period. Reinforce that this is factual, partnership-focused reporting.

sections.title: Metrics & Highlights
sections.description: 2-3 key findings from the data, organized by service line. Use neutral language (no facility comparisons). Reference specific numbers.

sections.title: Closing & Next Steps
sections.description: Summarize what these metrics mean for staffing planning. Invite questions. Close professionally.

verification_questions.question: Are all metrics correctly calculated from the JSON data? (Check: visits/shift, wRVU/shift, procedures/shift)
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Verify calculations match source data. No approximations or hallucinated numbers.

verification_questions.question: Does the email compare service lines fairly (apples-to-apples)? Are ICUs only compared to ICUs, etc.?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Ensure no cross-category comparisons. ICU to ICU, Floor to Floor only.

verification_questions.question: Are the key trends from the user's input incorporated naturally into the narrative?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Weave business context into the metrics discussion, don't just list facts.

verification_questions.question: Does the email avoid pitting facilities against each other? Is the tone neutral and data-focused?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Use phrases like 'across our network'. Frame variance as 'opportunities for learning'.

verification_questions.question: Is the email exactly 3 paragraphs? Does it stay focused on highlights vs. overwhelming detail?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Remove tangential details. Target: subject + opening + metrics + closing.

rubric.description: Quality criteria for productivity pulse emails

criteria.name: data_accuracy
criteria.description: Metrics are correct, calculations verified, no hallucinated numbers

criteria.name: fair_comparison
criteria.description: Apples-to-apples comparisons (ICU to ICU), no unfair facility rankings

criteria.name: clarity_and_focus
criteria.description: 3 paragraphs, highlights only, no overwhelming detail, easy to scan

criteria.name: professional_tone
criteria.description: Neutral, partnership-focused, collaborative language, no competitive framing
